snippet: About 5,000 people across France have been evacuated, and the Louvre and Musée d’Orsay announced closings. Meanwhile, rains have claimed several lives in Germany.
abstract: Thousands of people are evacuated and major museums in Paris close to protect artworks from severe flooding that has already killed at least 10 people throughout France and Germany; Pres Francois Hollande links rains, which also interrupted play at French Open, to global warming.

byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and KATARINA JOHANNSEN
byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden reported from Paris, and Katarina Johannsen from Berlin. Victor Homola contributed reporting from Berlin, and Henry Fountain from New York.

lead_paragraph: About 5,000 people across France have been evacuated, and the Louvre and Musée d’Orsay announced closings. Meanwhile, rains have claimed several lives in Germany.

headline.main: From Paris to Bavaria, Heavy Rains Cause Deadly Floods
headline.print_headline: Rains Cause Deadly Floods in France and Germany
